Article.Naam: Management of type 2 diabetes in the elderly

Question.Question: 1: The classic symptoms of diabetes are not always present in elderly patients with diabetes, and patients may present with non-specific symptoms such as fatigue, confusion, dehydration, weight loss or incontinence.
2: Elderly patients with diabetes are at higher risk than other older adults for several geriatric syndromes, which can be a major obstacle in the treatment and care of diabetic people.

3: Elderly patients are more vulnerable to hypoglycaemia, due to impaired counter-regulatory mechanisms. Avoidance of hypoglycaemia is therefore an important consideration when deciding on treatment goals and choosing hypoglycaemic agents for the elderly.
